Ability or tendency of an organism or cell to maintain internal equilibrium by adjusting its physiological processes

Increased cell size
Increased cell number
Conversion of one cell type to another
Disorderly growth
Loss of blood supply in a tissue due to impeded arterial flow or reduced venous drainage
Inadequate oxygenation of blood
An injury to any portion of the body from a blow, crush, cut, or penetrating wound
Medications that are with analgesic properties and that can induce sleep
Causes ATP depletion
Cause cell membrane damage
